definition: to bend in two so as to break/to defy/to disobey/also pr. [ao3]

sentences.english: The lake lies low by the hill, a tearful entreaty of love at the foot of the inflexible.
sentences.chinese: 湖躺在山腳下，像在執拗者的跟前含淚懇求愛。

sentences.english: I don't think Julie will change her mind. She's pretty hard-headed.
sentences.chinese: 我想墨麗亞不會轉變主張，由於她很執拗。

sentences.english: Bigotry is bad enough, as I had learned in Allentown.
sentences.chinese: 我過去在阿倫敦時就懂得，頑固執拗是夠糟糕的了。

sentences.english: Henry was more than a bigot. He was also a hypocrite.
sentences.chinese: 亨利不只是一個頑固執拗的人，他還是個僞君子。

sentences.english: The pertinacity of her friend seemed more than she could bear.
sentences.chinese: 她的朋友那樣執拗，看來真讓她受不了啦。

sentences.english: A bigot is a stone-deaf orator.
sentences.chinese: 執拗的人是全聾的演說者。

sentences.english: He was obdurate to refuse their plan.
sentences.chinese: 他執拗地拒絕他們的計劃。

sentences.english: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and stiffen your neck no more.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，你們要心受割損，不要再執拗。

sentences.english: “Lie down, lie down, ” the wonderful doctor insisted.
sentences.chinese: “躺下，躺下，”了不起的大夫執拗地說。

definition: to sever all relations with sb/determined/decisive
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
to take troubles to heart (idiom); brooding
